titles.title: Recognizing the importance of good cervical health and of detecting cervical cancer during its earliest stages.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.

committee.name: House Committee on Energy and Commerce

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Energy and Commerce

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Unanimous Consent.

committee.name: House Committee on Energy and Commerce

action.text: Mr. Bilirakis moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Con. Res. 309.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 361 - 0 (Roll no. 173).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.

committee.name: Senate Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

bill.summary: 5/20/2002--Passed House without amendment. Recognizes the importance of good cervical health and early cervical cancer detection and the courage of cervical cancer survivors. Urges medical institutions to continue to raise public awareness about cervical cancer and early detection.
